meanings.definition: In a reserved or modest manner
meanings.sent1: She spoke demurely during the meeting, not drawing attention to herself.
meanings.sent2: The young girl smiled demurely when complimented on her artwork.
meanings.sent3: The cat sat demurely on the windowsill, pretending not to notice the bird outside.
meanings.sent4: The flowers swayed demurely in the gentle breeze, as if dancing to a silent tune.
meanings.sent5: The old man nodded demurely, acknowledging the kindness of the stranger.

meanings.sent1: Her demurely downcast eyes revealed her shyness in social situations.
meanings.sent2: The demurely dressed woman caught everyone's attention with her quiet elegance.
meanings.sent3: The demurely decorated room had a calming effect on all who entered.
meanings.sent4: His demurely polite manners charmed even the most skeptical of guests.
meanings.sent5: The demurely blushing bride looked radiant in her simple white gown.
